snippet: In an agreement with Mr. Icahn, the activist investor, Xerox said it would spin off its services business by the end of the year.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and LESLIE PICKER

lead_paragraph: In an agreement with Mr. Icahn, the activist investor, Xerox said it would spin off its services business by the end of the year.
abstract: Xerox Corp announces plans to spin off its services business, largely consisting of Affiliated Computer Services, which it took over in 2009 for $6.4 billion; buying ACS was supposed to diversify Xerox's offerings, but CEO Ursula M Burns concedes it never fit with Xerox's core operations.

headline.print_headline: Stung by a Bad Purchase and Faltering in the Digital Era, Xerox Decides to Split Up
headline.main: Xerox, in Deal With Carl Icahn, to Split Company in Two
